PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MOBIDYN project: Combinatorial Model for Dynamic Networks
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The highly dynamic behavior of wireless networks make them very difficult to evaluate, e.g. as far as the performance of routing algorithms is concerned. However, some of them have a predictable dynamics, as the temporal variations in the network topology are somehow deterministic.

Recently, a graph theoretic model -- the \emph{evolving graphs} -- was proposed to help capture the dynamic behavior of these networks, in view of the construction of least cost routing and other algorithms.

We first implemented an evolving graph based routing protocol, and then evaluated such protocol compared to other major ad-hoc protocols through simulations. Our experiments showed that evolving graphs have all the potentials to be an effective and powerful tool in the development of algorithms for dynamic networks, with predictable dynamics at least. In order to make this model widely applicable, however, some practical issues still have to be addressed and incorporated into the model, like adaptive routing and stochastically predictable behavior .

This proposal aims to the extend the ongoing work that has being done by the MOBIDYN project (cooperation between FAPESP and INRIA on process number 04/14303-6).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto visa estudar o comportamento de transmissгo multimнdia em redes sem fio utilizando grafos evolutivos. Estes grafos fornecem previsхes sobre o comportamento das redes sem fio, permitindo assim a tomada de aзхes adaptativas mais apropriadas para as caracterнsticas dessas redes. A primeira parte desse trabalho pretende analisar as propostas recentes para distribuiзгo escalбvel de multimнdia e entender como esses modelos poderiam beneficiar-se da utilizaзгo de grafos evolutivos para a distribuiзгo sobre redes sem fio. A segunda parte compreende analisar com mais detalhes o recente modelo combinatуrio - \emph{grafos evolutivos} - que pode aproximar o comportamento dinвmico de redes sem fio, utilizando a noзгo do tempo em grafos. Com este modelo й possнvel formalizar vбrios resultados relativos a roteamento jб conhecidos anteriormente e desenvolver novos protocolos eficientes em diversas mйtricas. Em particular, uma questгo fundamental concerne o carбter aleatуrio, pouco previsнvel e distribuнdo das redes sem fio. Assim, concentraremos nossos esforзos na extensгo do modelo dos Grafos Evolutivos para que ele possa levar em conta essas caracterнsticas, atravйs por exemplo de modelos onde exista algum grau de incerteza.. Os algoritmos de roteamento que serгo concebidos estarгo entгo ainda mais perto da realidade das redes sem fio autфnomas. Finalmente, temos como meta unir os resultados dos dois estudos anteriores de forma a usar possнveis noзхes de previsibilidade na transmissгo multimidia em redes sem fio, alйm do aprimorimento do modelo de grafos evolutivos para suprir necessidades especнficas das transmissхes de бudio e vнdeo.

O Projeto InteGrade (\url{http://integrade}) visa desenvolver um middleware inovador que permita a
utilizaзгo de recursos computacionais ociosos existentes em instituiзхes acadкmicas e empresariais para a execuзгo de aplicaзхes cientнficas, industriais e de entretenimento que demandem alto podercomputacional. O middleware do InteGrade possibilita a formaзгo de \emph{Grades Computacionais Oportunistas}, i.e., coleзхes de aglomerados (\emph{clusters}) de computadores formados a partir de mбquinas jб existentes em um grupo de instituiзхes. O objetivo do InteGrade й oferecer aos usuбrios da Grade esse enorme poder computacional sem comprometer a Qualidade de Serviзo oferecida aos usuбrios locais e respectivos donos dos computadores compartilhados, os quais devem sempre ter prioridade.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Combinatorial Model for Dynamic Networks
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
As technology advances in the area of wireless networks and micro-electro-mechanical, it became possible to develop enhanced wireless communication micro-processed devices, with very low-cost, low-energy consumption and extremely reduced in size. These devices, when inter-connected, create a network called Wireless Sensors Networks (WSN).

There is a wide range of applications for these networks, in areas such as monitoring of environment conditions and colleting data in remote locations. These networks behavior is extremely dynamic. A key topic in this research is the routing algorithms taking into account the energy constraints.

The objective of this study is to analyze a recent combinatorial model - Evolving Graphs - that can harness the complexity of evolving environments. Such modeling helps to capture the behavior of dynamic networks over time allowing the formalization and improvement of the analysis of algorithms.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Internet do Futuro e Composiёc?ao de Serviёcos: Escalabilidade e Estabilidade
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A tecnologia de serviзos web possibilita encapsular serviзos e tornб-los acessнveis
via internet. A visгo de Internet do Futuro contempla a existкncia da Internet de
Serviзos. Dentre os vбrios desafios, estб a necessidade da criaзгo de tйcnicas de
combinaзгo de serviзos. A tйcnica mais convencional, chamada de Orquestraзгo,
envolve a utilizaзгo de um nу central que controla e executa a composiзгo. Uma
alternativa mais recente, conhecida como Coreografia, envolve um modelo em que
diferentes serviзos colaboram de maneira descentralizada para prover um serviзo
complexo.
Mas, atй o momento Coreografias ainda foram pouco estudadas, neste projeto
nуs nos propomos a estudar dois aspectos importantes de Coreografias, a anбlise de
interdependкncias e de estabilidade e a anбlise em tempo de design e de execuзгo
de coreografias.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: LEAPaD: Laboratуorio de Estudos Avaзados em Sistemas Paralelos e Distribuнdos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O processamento paralelo e distribuнdo й uma realidade nos sistemas computacionais hб muitos anos. No entanto, observa-se no histуrico mais recente, o crescimento dos horizontes de sua aplicaзгo em funзгo de uma nova realidade de mercado, a qual oferece preзos muito competitivos para os mais diversos tipos de plataformas de hardware, implicando no aumento das ofertas de soluзхes e, consequentemente, de demandas de aplicaзхes da sociedade em geral. Logo, se no passado nгo muito distante, problemas e questхes relacionadas ao processamento paralelo e distribuнdo surgiam em funзгo do desenvolvimento de aplicaзхes caracterizadas por necessitarem
de uma grande quantidade de recursos computacionais, hoje surge uma nova classe de problemas em funзгo da pluralidade de dimensхes que as novas plataformas de processamento oferecem. Esta pluralidade reflete a incorporaзгo nas plataformas de execuзгo de diferentes tecnologias de hardware com suporte ao processamento intensivo e paralelo, incluindo nгo apenas os multiprocessadores e aglomerados de computadores, mas tambйmFPGAs, GPUs, grades e nuvens computacionais.
Dentre os efeitos observados, buscam-se novos modelos computacionais para solucionar as diferentes questхes operacionais que se apresentam nesta nova realidade. Neste contexto, o presente projeto se insere apresentando a criaзгo do LEAPaD, um laboratуrio, virtualmente distribuнdo entre as instituiзхes parceiras, vocacionado em explorar questхes ligadas ao gerenciamento das aзхes que envolvem o processamento paralelo e distribuнdo. O LEAPaD, acrфnimo para Laboratуrio de Estudos Avanзados em Sistemas Paralelos e Distribuнdos, se institui de forma a consolidar linhas de atuaзгo ligadas aos programas associados a este projeto, buscando explorar soluзхes para construзхes de aplicaзхes e sistemas de gerenciamento e exploraзгo de processamento de alto desempenho em arquiteturas paralelas e distribuнdas, tais como FPGAs, ambientes multiprocessados e com GPUs,
aglomerados de computadores e de grades e nuvens computacionais.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Aplicaзхes do Modelo BSP para Computaзгoo de Alto Desempenho
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O projeto consiste em explorar o uso do modelo BSP (Bulk Synchronous Parallel) em dois ambientes ligados a computaзгo de alto desempenho. Os dois ambientes sгo: Placas Grбficas (GPUs) e nuvens computacionais. No primeiro caso, vamos comeзar usando o modelo BSP para previsгo de desempenho de aplicaзхes paralelas, mas vamos tambйm pesquisar ambientes com mais de uma GPU e o uso conjunto de CPUs e GPUs. No segundo caso, queremos estudar o desempenho de aplicaзхes paralelas escritas no modelo BSP em nuvens. Vamos comeзar inicialmente com nuvens controladas, onde todo o ambiente й conhecido, de forma a termos mais dados
para a segunda fase que vai consistir no uso de nuvens pъblicas. Escolhemos como ambiente inicial o OpenStack. Vamos tambйm pesquisar o uso de vбrias aplicaзхes simultaneamente, possivelmente alterando o nъmero de processadores BSP e mбquinas virtuais.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CHOOSING: COOPERATION ON HYBRID COMPUTING CLOUDS FOR ENERGY SAVING
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The cloud computing is an important factor for environmentally sustainable development. If, in the one hand, the increasing demand of users drive the creation of large datacenters, in the other hand, cloud computing?s ?multitenancy? trait allows the reduction of physical hardware and, therefore, the saving of energy. Thus, it is imperative to optimize the energy consumption corresponding to the datacenter?s
activities.
Three elements are crucial on energy consumption of a cloud platform: computation (processing), storage and network infrastructure. Therefore, the aim of this project is to provide different techniques to reduce energy consumption regarding these three elements.
Our work mainly focuses on energy saving aspects based on virtualization, i.e., pursuing the idea of the intensive migration of classical storage/processing systems to virtual ones. We will study how different organizations (whose resources are combined as hybrid clouds) can cooperate with each other in order to minimize the energy consumption without the detriment of client requirements or quality of service.
Then, we intend to propose efficient algorithmic solutions and design new coordination mechanisms that incentive cloud providers to collaborate.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto trata da investigaзгo dos desafios de confiabilidade (dependability) advindos
dos chamados sistemas distribuнdos dinвmicos caracterнsticos das novas tecnologias
de redes de computadores, tais como redes mуveis ad-hoc (MANET), redes
veiculares ad-hoc (VANET), Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access
(WiMax), Airborn Networks, DoD Global Information Grid, peer-to-peer (P2P) etc.
As aplicaзхes tнpicas desse tipo de rede tкm uma caracterнstica em comum: sгo
altamente dinвmicas em suas composiзхes - em termos de membros participantes
e recursos disponнveis em dado instante. Tal dinamismo resulta em incertezas e
nгo previsibilidade do ambiente computacional que colocam enormes desafios para
a implementaзгo de mecanismos de confiabilidade que garantam o funcionamento
correto do sistema.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Scrum is one of the agile methods gaining more relevance among academics and practitioners. It is mainly applied in the context of software development, which is a knowledge-intensive activity and depends on learning to evolve. Therefore, it becomes crucial to understand the question: Does Scrum implementation trigger a process of Organizational Learning? If ?Yes?, how does the OL occur? This relation has never been established in previous studies. The answer to these questions was based on a qualitative research, involving key members from UOL - the Brazilian most important company regarding content and services on the Internet, key members from an academic project and an expert in agile methods implementation. Among the main findings, we highlight that the process of Organizational Learning could be verified through the individual members? learning and through the changes within the organization in management, people, process and technology. Beyond the relation established between Organizational Learning and Scrum implementation, this study contributes in academic and practical fields by the identification of changes occurred in type of knowledge valued, physical structure, promotion criteria, and individual dependence decrease when implementing Scrum. It is perceived that knowledge management, as a way of perpetuating the learning in the organization is still a challenge for agile software organizations.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2012 IEEE Congress on Evolutionary Computation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Given multiple parallel heuristics solving the same problem, we are interested in combining them for taking advantage of their diversity. We propose to use the algorithm portfolio model of execution. In this model, we have multiple resources on which the candidate heuristics can be executed. An instance is solved through a concurrent execution of heuristics (each on a fraction of resources) that is stopped as soon as one of them completes its execution. The efficiency of this model depends among other things of the resource sharing adopted in a concurrent execution. In most algorithm portfolio studies, the resources fraction of a heuristic is fixed. In this paper, we consider malleable algorithm portfolio. In this portfolio model, the fraction of resources of a heuristic can be changed during its execution. We extend the computational model proposed in [1] to formalize the problem of resource sharing construction in malleable portfolio. We then propose an efficient algorithm based on the combination of two guaranteed approximation algorithms for solving it. Finally, we evaluate the proposed algorithm with multiple simulations on a database of SAT solvers. The obtained results show that even in considering that the resource allocation of a heuristic can just be changed once, malleable allocations in comparison to static ones lead to an improvement of the spent time for solving an instance in algorithm portfolio.time for solving an instance in algorithm portfolio.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: On Graph Reduction for QoS Prediction of Very Large Web Service Compositions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: On Graph Reduction for QoS Prediction of Very Large Web Service Compositions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Best Paper Award
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper, we investigate the question of QoS prediction of Web Service Composition (WSC) implementing a business process. We focus on the graph reduction technique and the prediction of the Service Response Time. In the graph reduction technique, we assume that a Web Service Composition can be represented as a graph. The main thesis is that the QoS of such a graph graph can be obtained from a composition of the ones of its nodes. Multiple graph reduction algorithms have been proposed in the literature. Our contribution is twofold. We propose first a fast algorithm based on graph reduction for the prediction of the Service Response Time of a Web Service Composition. In comparison to those existing in the literature, this algorithm uses less memory space and has a better time complexity. The obtained improvements are in particular significant on very large Web Service Composition where the number of services is huge. Our second contribution is an analysis of the graph reduction technique for QoS prediction that takes into account the unfolding of services. In such cases, we show that the prediction of QoS can lead to a NP-complete problem. We also provide an integer programming model for predicting the Service Response Time in this case.

Uncovering Steady Advances for an Extreme Programming Course
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Uncovering Steady Advances for an Extreme Programming Course

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents an empirical study about identifying improvement actions for an eXtreme Programming course in the academic environment. This exploratory study is undertaken in two preliminary phases. These phases are part of a wider research project to develop a theory about how to continuously improve courses of similar structure and content. The first phase consists of diagnosing improvement actions from the 2010 edition of the course through a qualitative analysis of data obtained using various methods: (1) students? responses to a questionnaire with open questions; and (2) students? opinions expressed in a final agile retrospective with all members of the course. The second phase consists of an early application of the identified improvements in the 2011 edition of the course to gather lessons learned, and develop a definite case study design to be used continuously in the next courses offered. Amongst the results, we found that the use of initiatives to promote interactions between groups like Coding Dojo and Brainwritting helps students to effectively learn and share knowledge and experiences, a problem still unsolved when thinking of scaling agile methods. Also, this paper allows keeping track on what is occurring in the course.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-CURSOS-CURTA-DURACAO-MIN.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA-DO-CURSO: 20th International Symposium on Computer Architecture and High Performance Computing

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Computationally-intensive problems that require large amounts of processing power are increasingly important for advances in science and technology in a wide variety of areas such as Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Engineering, and Finance. Up to the middle of the 1990s, these problems were resolved using large and highly-expensive parallel computers accessible to few research groups. Over the last 10 years, however, it became more efficient and inexpensive to invest in assembling and configuring clusters of inexpensive, commodity personal computers. These PC clusters can offer very large processing powers at a relatively low cost. Recently, the idea of linking multiple, geographically distributed clusters for the establishment of Computational Grids have been receiving more and more attention in both academia and industry. In this chapter, we present the basic concepts behind Grid Computing and describe some of the most important grid middleware systems and the programming models they support. Finally, we give a general overview of some of the most relevant grids currently in use.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Evolving Graphs and Delay Tolerant Networks

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Lately, there are many mobile networks with dynamic characteristics functioning. In these scenarios, the traditional static graph model may not completely represent the network's topology, which may vary over time.

One largely studied problem in those networks is message routing. Most algorithms that solve this problem make no assumptions about the network's topology and, thus, use statistical approaches. But, if some knowledge is considered about the connections, it can be modelled with an Evolving Graph and the optimal routes can be found.

In this project, we studied the most common routing protocols applied to real road scenarios, as well as the modelling of DTNs with Evolving graphs, the optimal journey algorithms and the intermediate optimal journeys.
